intro: Blumea elongata, commonly known as the slender blumea, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with slender, branching stems and opposite leaves that are usually lance-shaped. Its small yellow flowers are arranged in clusters, and it produces small, oval-shaped fruits called cypsela. Blumea elongata is often found in moist environments such as forests and wetlands.
